programme.title: Yellowstone Kelly
programme.desc: A trapper (Clint Walker) and his helper (Edd Byrnes) try to help an Indian girl escape from a Dakota chief (John Russell) and a warrior.

programme.title: The Moonlighter
programme.desc: A cattle herder/rustler (Fred MacMurray) escapes from a lynch mob but surrenders to his ex-girlfriend (Barbara Stanwyck).

programme.title: The Furies
programme.desc: A cattle baron's (Walter Huston) daughter (Barbara Stanwyck) vows to ruin his ranch and gets a shady banker (Wendell Corey) to help her do it.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene helps the son of a murdered man take over a freight-line business.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Two disgruntled ranch hands carry out a robbery in the guise of Pat and Gene.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: A crooked oil man tries to defraud a rancher out of his valuable property.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: Outlaws misinterpret a comment made by Roy and Dale.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: Gang of crooks locks Roy in his own jail. (1951)

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: Pat and Nellybelle are kidnapped by a gang of outlaws.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: A young man decides to escape his overbearing father by joining the Carlson gang.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: A drunk fuels conflict between two tribes on an Indian reservation.

programme.title: City of Bad Men
programme.desc: An outlaw (Dale Robertson) and his partners plan to rob the gate at the 1897 Corbett-Fitzsimmons fight in Carson City, Nev.

programme.title: These Thousand Hills
programme.desc: A cowboy (Don Murray) tries for easy money with his partner, then tries ranching with a saloon hostess's (Lee Remick) money.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Vigilantes want a Russian fur company driven out of town.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: A man gets victimized by a swindler when he gets to town.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: The vigilantes insist on lynching a man accused of murder.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Deputy Anthony Wayne tries to get a murder witness to talk.

programme.title: Lonesome Dove
programme.desc: Gus (Robert Duvall) is injured during an Indian attack; Call (Tommy Lee Jones) has a final run-in with Blue Duck.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: The townspeople leave Lucas to face killers alone.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas is accidentally responsible for the death of a young mountain boy.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: After winning a half-share of a Virginia City silver mine, Yancy discovers a neighboring mine stealing from it.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: General George Armstrong Custer visits New Orleans and experiences an assassination attempt.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: The town of Calico kills one of the Kiley brothers then makes a display of his burial on main street; Bill goes there to warn them that the Kiley gang is planning revenge.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Bill is working with a telegraph company installing lines, when an outlaw gang in the area intervenes and tries to get the crew to leave.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Bill is hired to drive a cattle herd to Abilene, but he must contend with two big problems: a hostile trail hand and a rival drive whose leader will stop at nothing to ensure that his herd gets to Abilene first.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: After failing in an attempt to ambush Bill, Bishop pays a band of Native Americans to attack the Akins herd, hoping to scatter the cattle and prevent them from reaching Abilene first.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Still leading the cattle drive, Bill takes his herd across a powerful rancher's land; he finds a woman who claims she is fleeing from a rancher's advances, but he learns that she isn't telling the whole truth.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: A former lawman who lost his nerve after a shooting incident is being harassed by brothers of a man he once killed; the ex-lawman's daughter refuses to let him fight back.

programme.title: Jeremiah Johnson
programme.desc: A recluse mountain man becomes the unwilling object of a long vendetta by Indians, and proves to be a match for their warriors.
